stories.text:
I really want to build my own queue of articles, videos and podcasts etc that is like my own personal curriculum of things I want to learn.

I want to be able order the queue though into a logical order and work through it sequentially. Both reading articles or listening via text to speech when on the go.

I use Pocket currently to save articles and listen but it doesn't have the ability to order the queue.

My problem is I always jump around just reading the latest things I saved or come across rather than building myself a stricter curriculum and sticking to getting through it in a logical order.

Does anyone else do something like this to structure your personal study and how do you do it?

Cheers!
stories.title: Ask HN: What's your workflow for personal learning?
FedEx to close data centers, retire all mainframes by 2024, saving $400m
‘Go home’: Honduran community fights against crypto colonialists

stories.text:
Hi HN, I started building this around 6 months back. Having a full-time job makes it difficult to work on a side project. People say the hardest part is marketing but repetitive development is very boring. I will definitely choose a fun-ner side project than this if this fails. It's such a tiring journey as a solo developer/founder/marketer.

The tech stack is Node.js and Angular.

Daspoll is a survey builder for everyone.
stories.title: Show HN: Daspoll – Survey and Form Builder

stories.text:
After some effort to find decent Android TV Web Browser that can work without hacks and support basic 'mouse' navigation using TV remote, I wrote one myself.

Doesn't spy at all and has no idea what you are looking at. All the traffic goes directly to Android TV device with no intermediary servers. Under active development so with feedback it can only get better.

Very useful, very decent performance, will always remain free, will never spy on you.

Web site:

http://iberapps.com/

Google Play:

https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.iberapps.cleartvwebbrowser
stories.title: Show HN: I Made a Decent Android TV Web Browser
